original: @137b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @137b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: panytsa g'a th'a n'a ma /
analyzed: panytsa g'a th'a n'a ma /
translated: Pañcagaṇṭhā-nāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Five Verses

original: dpal he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal he ru ka la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Heruka.

original: chu zad pas ni 'dam gyi padma skams //
analyzed: chu zad pas ni 'dam gyi padma skams //
translated: The lotus in the mud dries up from lack of water,

original: sbrang rtsi bros pas gar song cha yang med //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi bros pas gar song cha yang med //
translated: The honey is gone, there is no trace of where it went.

original: rtsa ba lo ma sdong po me yi sbyor bas zad //
analyzed: rtsa ba lo ma sdong po me yi sbyor bas zad //
translated: The roots, leaves, and trunk are consumed by the fire.

original: nag po na re dbang po'i bzhad gad la ni ltos //
analyzed: nag po na re dbang po'i bzhad gad la ni ltos //
translated: Kṛṣṇa says, Look at the laughter of the senses.

original: za zhing 'thung dang gnas nas yal ga bcag nas song //
analyzed: za zhing 'thung dang gnas nas yal ga bcag nas song //
translated: Eating, drinking, breaking branches from the dwelling, and leaving.

original: kye ho 'di ni bdag gi las ni gtum mo lta bu yin //
analyzed: kye ho 'di ni bdag gi las ni gtum mo lta bu yin //
translated: Alas! This is my work, like a fierce fire.

original: rgyun gyi ba mo @138a * //
analyzed: rgyun gyi ba mo @138a * //
translated: Like a continuous frost,

original: lta bus padma bsregs //
analyzed: lta bus padma bsregs //
translated: the lotus is burned.

original: yon tan brgya ni skyon gcig gis ni zad par byas //
analyzed: yon tan brgya ni skyon gcig gis ni zad par byas //
translated: A hundred qualities are destroyed by a single fault.

original: rgya mtsho zad pas padma rnams kyang skams //
analyzed: rgya mtsho zad pas padma rnams kyang skams //
translated: The lotuses dry up from the exhaustion of the ocean.

original: de tshe sgo bcu las ni du ba byung //
analyzed: de tshe sgo bcu las ni du ba byung //
translated: At that time, smoke arose from the ten directions.

original: 'jig rten pa ni nag po med ces zer //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni nag po med ces zer //
translated: The worldly ones say, Kṛṣṇa is gone.

original: nag po theg chen zab mo'i nags na gnas //
analyzed: nag po theg chen zab mo'i nags na gnas //
translated: Kṛṣṇa dwells in the forest of the profound Mahāyāna.

original: sems ni stong zhing gnyug ma'i ngang du rdzogs //
analyzed: sems ni stong zhing gnyug ma'i ngang du rdzogs //
translated: The mind is empty and perfect in the innate state.

original: phung po bzhad gad gyur kyang 'gyod pa med //
analyzed: phung po bzhad gad gyur kyang 'gyod pa med //
translated: Even if the aggregates laugh, there is no regret.

original: 'o ma'i nang na mar yod pa ni mi mthong bzhin //
analyzed: 'o ma'i nang na mar yod pa ni mi mthong bzhin //
translated: Just as butter is not seen in milk,

original: 'dod pa yod de 'jig rten pas ni ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa yod de 'jig rten pas ni ma mthong ngo //
translated: Desire exists, but is not seen by the worldly.

original: 'jig rten 'tsho ba 'am ni 'chi ba gang yang med //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'tsho ba 'am ni 'chi ba gang yang med //
translated: There is neither life nor death in the world.

original: 'di lta'i longs spyod nag po rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: 'di lta'i longs spyod nag po rnal 'byor pa //
translated: Such black enjoyments of the yogi,

original: padma bzhin du lus cha skams gyur kyang //
analyzed: padma bzhin du lus cha skams gyur kyang //
translated: Even if the body dries up like a lotus,

original: nag po ci yi phyir na shi zhes bya //🔽brtul zhugs spyod pa'i slob dpon chen po nag pos mdzad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: nag po ci yi phyir na shi zhes bya // brtul zhugs spyod pa'i slob dpon chen po nag pos mdzad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lnga pa rdzogs so /
translated: Why, O Black One, do you say die?🔽The five verses composed by the great master of yogic conduct, Krishna, are complete.

original: // / rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug shr'i bee ro tsa na badzra sa bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug shr'i bee ro tsa na badzra sa bsgyur ba'o//
translated: Translated by the lord of yogis, Shri Virupakshavajra.
